Returns the (single) tuple object associated with this graph. Subsequence calls always return the same object.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
Returns nodeCount() == 0. Note that a graph with no nodes, cannot possibly have any edge.

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface InspectableGraph

areAdjacent

public boolean areAdjacent(Node n1,
                           Node n2)
Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
Returns whether there exists an edge connecting the specified nodes. This is equivalent to areAdjacent(n1, n2, Direction.EITHER)

Specified by:
areAdjacent in interface InspectableGraph
See Also:
InspectableGraph.areAdjacent(Node, Node, Direction)

areAdjacent

public boolean areAdjacent(Node n1,
                           Node n2,
                           Direction direction)
Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
Returns whether there exists an edge connecting the specified nodes, with the specified direction. That is, to return true there must be an edge e such that:
  • If direction is Direction.OUT, e.n1() == n1 && e.n2() == n2
  • If direction is Direction.IN, e.n2() == n1 && e.n1() == n2
  • If direction is Direction.EITHER, e.isIncident(n1) && e.isIncident(n2)

    • Specified by:
    areAdjacent in interface InspectableGraph
    See Also:
    InspectableGraph.areAdjacent(Node, Node, Direction)

    edges

    public ExtendedListIterable<Edge> edges(Node node)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns an ExtendedListIterable over all edges that contain the specified node. This is equivalent to edges(node, Direction.EITHER)

    Specified by:
    edges in interface InspectableGraph
    Parameters:
    node - the node that all the returned edges must contain

    edges

    public ExtendedListIterable<Edge> edges(Node n1,
                                        Node n2)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns an ExtendedListIterable over all edges that connect the specified nodes, in either direction. This is equivalent to edges(n1, n2, Direction.EITHER).

    Specified by:
    edges in interface InspectableGraph

    adjacentNodes

    public ExtendedListIterable<Node> adjacentNodes(Node n)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns an ExtendedListIterable over all nodes that are neighbors with the specified node. Two nodes are "neighbors" if there exists an edge connecting the two. Actually, for every incident edge, a neighbor is reported, so in the case of parallel edges, neighbors are reported multiple times. This is equivalent to adjacentNodes(node, Direction.EITHER)

    Specified by:
    adjacentNodes in interface InspectableGraph
    See Also:
    InspectableGraph.adjacentNodes(Node, Direction)

    degree

    public int degree(Node node)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns the degree of the specified node.

    Specified by:
    degree in interface InspectableGraph

    degree

    public int degree(Node node,
                  Direction direction)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns the degree of the specified node, depending on direction:
  • Direction.OUT: equivalent to outDegree(node)
  • Direction.IN: equivalent to inDegree(node)
  • Direction.EITHER: equivalent to degree(node)

    • Specified by:
    degree in interface InspectableGraph
